section.title: What is the Geography Editor?
section.para: The Geography Editor is an open source desktop solution for authoring, managing and integrating state of the art Geographic Information System GIS technologies based on the OpenGIS Key Hole Markup Language KML.

section.title: Project Goals
section.para: The KML is an industry standard GIS markup language for creating documents for presenting geography information in 2 dimensional maps and 3 dimensional Geobrowsers. The Eclipse Modeling Framework EMF is an Eclipse-based modeling framework and code generation facility for building tools and other applications based on a structured data model.

The primary goal of the Geography Editor project is to build an EMF data model and editor for KML to provide the foundation for easily integrating location information into EMF tools, applications, and other EMF based data models.

section.title: Functional Overview
section.para: KML documents can be created from any of the free or commercially available XML based editors or from utilities associated with many of the KML based Geobrowswer applications. While the Geography Editor Feature provides an alternative Editor for authoring KML documents, the Geography Editor Feature's primary function is to enable the integration of all KML documents, no matter how they were originally created, with the EMF application framework in order to leverage existing and future EMF based tools, utilities and data models.

note.para: While the Geographic Editor Feature does provide a KML editor, it's fundamental purpose is to act as a base technology by offering a KML/EMF data model, that can be easily extended by other features that require GIS data integration.

section.title: Geography Documents
section.para: The Geography Editor enables users to create, transform and edit KML documents. See KML Introduction for basic information about creating and editing KML documents.

note.para: Geography document files utilize a .kml file extension to distinguish them from other types of files.

section.title: Geography Data Model
section.para: All operator activity centers around the creation, manipulation and visualization of Geography Documents. To understand the structure (called the data model) see the KML Reference for more information.

note.para: The Geography Data Model conforms to Google's Extensions to KML.

section.title: Creating a new Document
section.para: To create a new Geography document. Go to the File menu and launch a New Wizard by selecting the menu items:File|New|Other. .

figure.title: New Wizard for Creating a New Geography Document

section.para: Follow the instructions to choose a project, folder and a name for the document. Select one of the KML elements in the list for the root of the document and press Finish to create the document.
